segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is right in the middle of the puddle, but she’s just standing there like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really focused on those dishes, or maybe she’s just ignoring the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall off that stool, and the girl is just waiting for a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everyone is in the middle of this chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s like a storm is brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like it’s about to collapse at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little sorry for them, even though they’re making bad choices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is practically empty now, and the boy is still reaching for more.
segments.speaker: PAR
